title: RelaCtrl: Relevance-Guided Efficient Control for Diffusion Transformers
author: Ke Cao (University of Science and Technology of China), Jing Wang (Sun Yat-sen University), Ao Ma (360 AI Research), Jiasong Feng (360 AI Research), Zhanjie Zhang (360 AI Research), Xuanhua He (University of Science and Technology of China), Shanyuan Liu (360 AI Research), Jie Zhang (Hefei Institutes of Physical Science, Chinese Academy of Sciences)
relevance_why: The techniques explored in this paper, such as efficient parameter allocation and modeling optimizations in neural networks, could influence speech synthesis models where resource efficiency is crucial.
background: The paper focuses on improving text-to-image and text-to-video generation efficiency by optimizing the integration of control information in diffusion transformers.
contribution: RelaCtrl introduces a relevance-guided framework to enhance the integration of control signals in diffusion transformers, achieving a parameter reduction of 15% while maintaining performance.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Previous methods increased model complexity significantly by duplicating blocks or introducing redundant parameters without considering the relevance of layers.
technical_comparison.novelty: This work systematically evaluates layer relevance, leading to targeted control layer placements that conserve computational resources.

key_innovation: It employs a novel Two-Dimensional Shuffle Mixer to replace traditional self-attention mechanisms, streamlining the control layers for efficient computation.
real_world_impact: The proposed method could significantly reduce computational costs in diffusion models, making them more accessible for commercial applications where processing efficiency is essential.

new_terms.ControlNet Relevance Score: **ControlNet Relevance Score** quantifies the importance of control layers in a network based on their impact on generation quality, guiding resource allocation.
new_terms.Two-Dimensional Shuffle Mixer: **Two-Dimensional Shuffle Mixer** is a new component that mixes token and channel information in a randomized manner to improve efficiency over standard models.

open_sourcing: More examples are available at https://relactrl.github.io/RelaCtrl/
